Secretary of State Mike Pompeo on Sunday hailed the possibility of a brief cease-fire in Afghanistan, saying it is “time for peace” in the country where U.S. troops continue to fight in the longest-running war in American history.

Pompeo stressed that there are no “obstacles to talks” and that the U.S. stands ready to broker discussions between Ghani’s government and the Taliban, the militant organization the U.S. sought to oust from power for providing shelter to al Qaeda before the Sept. 11, 2001, attacks.

“The United States supports President Ghani’s offer for comprehensive negotiations on a mutually agreed agenda.”
